p: Similar to groups 3 and 4 in the PCA of Figure 5, branching patterns in the Figure 6 dendrogram conveys secondary branches specifically for maaliol rich species (branch B) and P. incisa (branch C), respectively. In the current study, P. incisa (INA-1a to -1e and -2) was the next species after P. lanceolata with high sampling numbers, with six replicates. The strongly incised juvenile leaves of P. lanceolata resemble those from P. incisa to an extent.
